Defining the nature and extent of the midbrain lesion and excluding haemorrhage or aneurysm are urgent because they determine acute treatment, while further imaging, CSF studies and serology help differentiate ischaemic, demyelinating, inflammatory, infectious and neoplastic causes and characterise the optic neuropathy and vascular risk profile.
